reviewText: In this movie we see what could have been if Nicole Eggert had not left Baywatch because she overestimated her appeal as a movie actress.  This is one of her few roles as the lead lady, and she does very well.Those who  remember her from her role in "Charles in Charge" will notice a  big difference between the two characters, though both are spoiled rich  girls.This movie also shows how a well meaning guy can get into trouble  when he listens to his hormones. Niclole's character, Megan Bowen, tells  her "boyfriend" that her father abuses her, and that in order for  them to be together, he must kill him.In short, she bewitches him into a  murder conspiracy.  This is a fairly well written and acted movie for the  price.  It has been very underated by critics.  The nude scenes of Nicole  are nice and seductive, but use your brain and view it w/o your kids.

reviewText: This movie is not for the young or the faint of heart. It is a psychological thriller, filled with sex and violence amidst the drama surrounding teen love or is it LOVE. The two Corey's come together again in ways you would not expect. This is unlike anything I have ever seen them doing. Some nudity, boy [...] and girl [...], sexually graphic with actual sex sounds. No intercourse visible but extremely suggestive covered by blankets, oral sex. Love triangles. Murder and mayhem. Teen alcohol usage.Nicole has a protective father, a dead mother, a clean cut boyfriend (Haim) and alot of money. More people are meant to die but who will kill who. Love triangles can tear a family apart in more ways than one. Good ADULT viewing. Kept me riveted to the edge of my seat.
summary: Much more than an Erotic Thriller

reviewText: Let's get this straight right from the start.  The only reason to see "Blown Away" is if you desperately want to see Nicole Eggert or Corey Haim nude.  If that is the case, I would highly recommend that you find a copy of the unrated version.  With that out of the way, I can tell you that this "thriller" is utterly ridiculous.Nicole Eggert plays an unhappy teenager named Megan.  She has a nasty habit of blowing up people she doesn't like.  That even includes her family.  Somehow, Megan has got her hands on several bombs with those nifty little digital readouts on them.  Here's the best part though.  These aren't your regular run-of-the-mill bombs.  Nope.  These are special ones which explode so completely that there isn't a trace of them left after they blow up.  And all this time I had thought that only guns and drugs were easily attainable in our school system.  I guess untraceable explosive devices can be purchased as well.If you want to see how silly this movie is, you only have to watch the first couple of minutes.  "Blown Away" starts off by showing Megan's mom driving her car down the road.  A bomb is attached to the bottom of her vehicle and KABOOM! it goes off.  Unfortunately, the explosion is a minor one and simply causes flames to shoot out of the back of her car.  Fortunately, she loses control of her car and plows into two gas pumps which are conveniently located directly in front of her.  No...I am not kidding.  The movie continues in this amateurish fashion and the "surprise" ending is only a surprise if you have never seen a thriller before in your entire life."Blown Away" was the fourth movie to star Corey Haim and Corey Feldman together.  While films such as "The Lost Boys" and "License To Drive" used them well together, this movie uses their pairing simply as a gimmick.  Kathleen Robertson ("90210") has a relatively minor role and her presence is completely wasted.  Stay away from this one unless your desire to see Nicole, Corey, or Corey (yes...even Feldman is briefly in the buff) sans clothes.
Title: N/A

reviewText: In 1988, a pretty decent thriller released named "Masquerade."  Rob Lowe, Meg Tilly, Kim Cattrall, and well, even Doug Savant, an OK actor from the sometimes funny television show "Melrose Place."  Hey, who can forget those scenes with Marcia Cross in the psycho ward, playing "Betsy" (or was it "Betty"?), or the over-the-top scenes with "special guest star" Heather Locklear.  How long can you be on a TV show and still be called a "special guest star," anyways?Now, "Masquerade" surely wasn't Academy Award material, but for a thriller with lots of twisteroos it was pretty decent.  "Blown Away," however, is a film that released about four years later that has a suspiciously similar plotline, even though it took me a few minutes to remember which movie that it reminded me of.  Hey, this was the first time that I've viewed this tonight, and I haven't seen "Masquerade" in almost 20 years.The cast here certainly is inferior to that superior film.  I've always thought that, while Corey Haim was alright, that he and his buddy Corey Feldman only got work for so long because they were friends with the same first name; it was kind of a cheap marketing ploy.  I thought that Nicole Eggert was decent, although the director tried to up the ante by having her walk around mostly naked in this film.  Hey, you can hide a bad script sometimes by exposing some skin, I suppose.And while I believe that this film was perhaps a ripoff of "Masquerade," I think that that film worked while this one didn't since most of the plot elements in "Masquerade" seemed possible, while "Blown Away" just had too many twisteroos and double crosses for me to believe.Well, I call a "push" on the riske scenes with Ms. Catrall and Ms. Eggert.  I call a "win" for "Masquerade" on overall acting and plausible plot.  And I call "foul" on this one for below-average acting and just ripping off "Masquerade."  And that means that this really is just a masquerade of a film.

reviewText: First note:  This is not the same film as the Jeff Bridges/Tommy Lee Jones thriller about a mad IRA bomber.  This movie came much earlier.I remember when this movie first came out in the theatres.  It looked ridiculous then and it certainly does now.  Give credit to the two Coreys, Haim and Feldman, for going against their usual goody-two-shoes pairing and delving into such decidedly sleazy material as this.  And give credit to Nicole Eggert, who has an undeniable allure and does Basic Instinct, Jr. here with remarkable lack of inhibition.But do these elements make a good movie?  Not really, considering Haim's watery presence as a leading man and the ridiculous characterizations and situations.  Feldman fares better as a punk so sleazy that you just have to smile at his behaviour.  The finale is especially wanting, a lacklustre bedroom confrontation that is strictly made-for-TV in its staging and dialogue.  So all that's left is a surprisingly erotic first encounter between Eggert and Haim, some snippets of nudity, and a slightly disturbing feeling for the audience.  Like the film Kids and Bully, this movie makes you into a voyeur into an explicit portrayal of teen sex lives, though unlike these two films, Blown Away is so cartoonish in execution and tone that it qualifies mostly as a conduit for the eye candy of Haim and Eggert.
summary: One or two hot sex scenes; that's about it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Corey Haim & Corey Feldman are at it again.  After making some A-list movies (the biggest beingThe Lost Boys) and being in & out of rehab, they pair up again in the present film.  In it they play brothers who have some animosity over both women and dysfunctional family issues.One would think that Haim & Feldman would be the stars of the show.  Not this time.  Both are overshadowed by Nicole Eggert.  It appears that this movie is where she breaks-ties with her sweet little innocent teenager character that she played on CHARLES IN CHARGE.  Mission accomplished!  She plays Megan;  a spoiled, vindictive, manipulative, sultry, sadistic femme fatale.  Megan has a penchant for blowing things up, but she finds the opportunity to strip down several times during the film (way to go Nicole!).  Oh, and did I mention she's smokin' hot?  She is built like a cheerleader and I found her absolutely intoxicating - even though her character was despicable.  It appears that she wanted to follow in the footsteps of Alyssa Milano, another kid star-turned erotic actress.  Somewhere along the line, it seems Nicole's plans were shelved as I could only find her in one other movie on Amazon.com.In any case, if you like "B" movies that are entertaining and / or sexy, then this one belongs on your shelf.  A young Kathleen Robertson stars in a bit role, but even with it you can tell that she has considerable acting ability.  For Nicole Eggert fans (like me!) this DVD is an absolute must-have.

reviewText: Unintentionally horrible. This attempt at an erotic thrill starring THE TWO COREYS, WHOA! is like watching a train wreck that you just can't stop watching... I was 21 when I first saw this on Cinemax, like 20 years ago.. I bought it on VHS and then upgraded on DVD.. I had a huge crush on Corey Haim while growing up (same age and all).. But I always knew Haim was gay..and the so called sex scenes in this back that up. Haim is painful, almost awkward to watch in those scenes. He looks so uninterested.There's one scene where he threw his head back, when typically the female would be doing that.. It's kinda funny.. Btw, the DVD version is touted as the R Rated edition, but it's actually the Unrated version in disguise; as another reviewer pointed out as well.. It's running time is 1 Hour 32 Minutes  and 57 Seconds.. That said, the movie is pretty bad, but given the later Corey movies, even the ones Haim did alone, this is still the best of the bunch... but it's no Basic Instinct.
summary: "THERE'S NOTHING YOU CAN SAY OR DO TO EVER MAKE HIM CHOOSE YOU."

reviewText: I didn't know who she was.  I never watched Charles in Charge or even Baywatch!  I saw this movie on either HBO or Cinemax while in college, and just fell in love with it (AND her).Nothing in this world like watching a young couple like Haim and Eggert get down and dirty throughout the movie.  It made me kind of sad because at the time I had wished I could meet a girl like that, but I have had the kind of sex Haim and "the Egg" had here with other girls in my recent past. :-)Without giving the movie away though, even I have to admit I felt that Nicole's character, Megan, got what she deserved at the end of the movie.I personally was "blown away" by the discovery that there actually was an UNRATED version of this movie!  I thought "how much MORE could they show?!"  The 2 minutes in the unrated version prove to show a LOT more then the R version.Ladies and gentlemen, all I have to say is; if you like Nicole Eggert, you'll LOVE this movie!  No lover of "the Egg" should be without this movie!  Now they need to put it out on DVD, and, unlike other low-budget movies recently hitting deev, do it RIGHT (movie trailers, maybe a few deleted scenes, etc.)
summary: THE MOVIE THAT INTRODUCED ME TO NICOLE EGGERT!!!!!!!!!!

reviewText: The basis of this film revolves around Nicole Eggert as the rebellious 17 year old Megan, who's living an "on the edge" lifestyle. She lives with her verbally abusive dad, Cy, both of whom are coping with the death of her mother who recently died in a mysterious car explosion. A year later, she's saved during a horse ride gone wrong by Rich Gardner (Corey Haim)  a young man who works at the ski resort owned by her father Cy. She repays him saving her life by inviting him to her house to have sex in her father's bed.With the advice of his older half-brother, Wes, Rich enters into a relationship with Megan which starts out great. But when Wes' girlfriend, Darla is found mysteriously murdered and Megan begins luring Rich into into criminal acts, Rich begins becoming suspicious of Megan's ulterior motives and wonders if she's truly the girl she's lead him on into believing she is. After Rich is framed for a recent string of murders, he realizes that Megan is out for more than love and loyalty and is using him as a pawn for her deadly game of murder and deceit.Overall: This passed as a decent erotic thriller. The acting is presentable but the story doesn't do a good job of keeping the viewer's attention. And since this is an erotic type of movie, expect there to be a sex scene literally every 10 minutes for the duration of the movie. It almost seems like sex is more of the focus than the actual story itself. The movie doesn't really become good until around the last 15 minutes when it starts to really grab your attention. Overall, this is an okay film. Nothing more, nothing less. I'd skip on this one, unless you want to see Nicole Eggert nude about 10 times, then pick this one up

reviewText: I have to hand to the two Corey's, who wouldn't want to get naked with Nicole, this film which was done on a low budget no doubt is quite suspenseful, & Corey Haim really does a pretty good job in his first adult role, I think him & Nicole Eggert might have  had a real relationship at one time, she indicated that when talking about his untimely death a few years back, that his substance abuse is what led to their seperation, after watching this one you will likely believe it to be true, there isn't much I can add that others haven't already added in other reviews, except to say that this is more of a cautionary tale of how a guy can get caught up with the wrong woman & totally have his life turned upside down, as one reviewer already said, she gives Sharon Stone's "Basic Instinct" character a run for her money, Nicole Eggert is hot & evil at the same time, her demise at the end shows just how evil she is to think she could out shoot police, however, she is definately the opposite of her character on the show "Baywatch" no doubt, in addition to her nakedness, we also get a seductive dance from her in a bar, it is easy to see how any guy could find her irresistable, & Corey Haim does a good job portraying such a guy, any guy who has been in a relationship like this can identify with his fustration as she leads him on in some way or another, Corey Feldman once again plays a supporting role to Haim, but has a secret all his own, not their best film together, that honor goes "The Lost Boys", however, this one is good as a suspence thriller.

reviewText: Mr. Haim and Nicole Eggert are great in this erotic thriller. So much suspense and romance that can't hold a top on a box without exploding. The dramatic scenes in this film are heartwarming, enchanting, and philosophical. You don't know what's going to happen next. Corey Feldman has a great role in this film and the bond that Haim and Eggert find is memorable. The early 90's film plays like a vivid illusion and after you watch it you'll ask yourself, "Was that a film or did I just wake up from a dream?"

reviewText: Cory Feldman/Corey Haim/smokin hot pre-Celebrity Fat Camp Nicole Eggert, 1992 erotic action B....do we have your attention yet? Well we certainly hope so, and if not then please stop reading this review cause it will not apply to you. A year beforeDeath Ringthe ambigiously gay duo of Corey Haim and Corey Feldman took one last stab at trying to make it "big" by pumping out one of the worst/greatest films the universe will ever have to offer. It is just another perfect piece of evidence to our theory that the 90's had B down to a perfect science that just can't seem to be duplicated in any sense. This film is so unintentionally hilarious that you will be left in pure confusion to how the Corey's didn't pull in numerous Oscars for their breath taking performances.We start off with Rich (Corey Haim) and Wes (Cory Feldman) as they are working at a ski lodge pumping out inaudible dialogue. Turns out these two are brothers that are on a constant quest for ladies closing deals with a 95% rating. Feldman is sporting a fantastic ponytail and somehow fell across the idea he's the world's toughest man, while Haim is a horse riding pretty boy still looking the same as he did years earlier. Once Haim meets Nicole Eggert the heat is on with at least 5 erotic scenes that would have left a young Sid is pure Saturday night delight. Eggert spends half the film in the buff...but unfortunately so does Haim. With all the booty time going on Haim gets caught up in a perverse web of deceit that may put him behind bars for lifeBlown Away is more then just the title, it's the experience you'll feel after 90 of the finest minutes life has to offer. In fact it was so good that when Tommy Lee went to snatch the title in his 1994 release called "Blown Away" Corey Feldman went to his house and held him by his ankle over the 13th story balcony until he coughed up $25 and a 15 dollars in Arby's coupons. Luckily in the end all the trades worked out and this Blown Away will remain the only true version with some of the finest acting in the business. Santa would have loved it on the sheer fact it had one of the original same color girls nude most the way through. Oh yeah Eggert yeah!
summary: That hot tubs a real creepy scene right now

reviewText: "Blown Away" is one of the funniest (not intentional) and sexiest (very intentional) B-movies ever made.  In what other film can you find Cory Feldam pulling wicked 80's dance moves  and 90 seconds later see Nicole Eggert (looking her absolute best) fully de-robing.  Nicole engages in no less than five 'scenes' in this film.  Whoah.GOOD NEWS RE: 93 v. 91 MINUTE RUNTIME:  This DVD ordered from Amazon is the full, uncut 93 minute version of the film.  I have seen the VHS version which is missing ~2 minutes of Nicole. That was a huge disappointment.  And while the DVD case itself says the running time is 91 minutes, don't let that fool you: this movie is in its original and perfect wholeness.
